name: hatomici
body: |- wi(wne(c0, c0h), wrex(s0, cat, wss(cv(s0), c0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wne(c0, c0h), wrex(s0, cat, wss(cv(s0), c0)))
-| wcel(c0, csh)
-| diffsc(s0, c0)
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ≠ 0H → ∃(s0 ∈ HAtoms, s0 ⊆ c0))
⊣ c0 ∈ SH
⊣ d(s0, c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wne(c0, c0h), wrex(s0, cat, wss(cv(s0), c0)))
-| wcel(c0, csh)
-| diffsc(s0, c0)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ≠ 0H → ∃(s0 ∈ HAtoms, s0 ⊆ c0))
⊣ c0 ∈ SH
⊣ d(s0, c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wne(c0, c0h), wrex(s0, cat, wss(cv(s0), c0)))
-| diffsc(s0, c0)
-| wcel(c0, cch)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ≠ 0H → ∃(s0 ∈ HAtoms, s0 ⊆ c0))
⊣ d(s0, c0)
⊣ c0 ∈ CH

comment: The Hilbert lattice is atomic, i.e. any nonzero element is greater than or equal to some atom. Remark in [Kalmbach] p. 140. (Contributed by NM, 22-Jul-2001.) (New usage is discouraged.)
